en: He discharged his duties.
He has completely lost all sense of duty.
He was assailed with doubts.
He is without doubt the most successful movie director in the world.
ko: 걔는 의심할 여지 없이 세계에서 가장 성공한 영화감독이야.

en: He is beyond doubt the best athlete in our school.
ko: 걔는 분명 우리 학교에서 제일 뛰어난 운동선수야.

en: He bowed out as engineer.
He is going to be an engineer.
He wants to be an engineer.
He was an engineer and was treated as such.
ko: 걔는 엔지니어였고 그에 걸맞은 대우를 받았어.

en: He was cheated into accepting the forged check.
He furnished food to the hungry.
ko: 걔는 배고픈 사람들에게 먹을 걸 나눠줬어.

en: He has set down everything that happened.
ko: 걔는 일어난 일을 전부 다 기록해 뒀어.

en: He got up to see if he had turned off the light in the kitchen.
ko: 걔는 주방 불을 껐는지 확인하려고 일어났어.

en: He springs from a noble family.
He is very busy writing stories.
He has a good memory.
He is suffering from loss of memory.
He lost his memory.
He was excluded from the club for infractions of the rules.
He explained the rules in detail.
He advocates a revision of the rules.
He felt hedged in with rules.
He got off the train.
He got on the train.
He began to feel ill.
He looks bad-tempered, but he is kind at heart.
ko: 걔는 인상은 험악해 보여도 속은 착해.

en: He was hard to please.
He is generous to excess.
He's very generous, so let's go with him.
He is young at heart.
He has a noble mind.
His troubles led him to drink.
ko: 걔는 힘든 일들 때문에 술에 손을 대기 시작했어.

en: He was at ease with strangers.
ko: 걔는 낯선 사람들과도 편하게 잘 지냈어.

en: He fainted and fell on his back.
He's unlucky to a pitiful extent.
He glanced at her with no sign of recognition.
ko: 걔는 모르는 사람인 것처럼 그녀를 슥 쳐다봤어.

en: He is not all there.
He seems to be in a dark humor.
ko: 걔 기분이 좀 안 좋아 보여.

en: He has a bad temper.
He has a generous nature.
He's interested in many things.
He has gone mad.
He went crazy.
He found himself lying on a bench in the park.
ko: 정신을 차려보니 걔는 공원 벤치에 누워 있었어.

en: He had an accident on his way home.
ko: 걔는 집에 오는 길에 사고가 났어.

en: He met Sammy Davis, Jr. on his way home.
ko: 걔는 집에 오는 길에 새미 데이비스 주니어를 만났어.

en: No sooner had he come home than he proudly made an earth-shattering announcement.
ko: 걔는 집에 오자마자 아주 당당하게 깜짝 놀랄 만한 발표를 했어.

en: He phoned her as soon as he came home.
He went to bed the moment he arrived home.
He wavered between going home and remaining at work in the office.
ko: 집에 갈지 아니면 사무실에 남아서 일할지 고민했어요.

en: I suppose he's gone home.
He learned of his friend's death in the automobile accident when he came home.
ko: 집에 와서 친구가 교통사고로 죽었다는 소식을 들었어요.

en: He made a request to return to his home country.
He was ordered home.
He is homeward bound.
He pledged to marry me when he returned home.
ko: 그는 집에 돌아오면 저랑 결혼하겠다고 약속했어요.

en: Upon arriving home, he immediately set about preparing a meal.
ko: 집에 오자마자 바로 밥을 차리기 시작했어요.

en: He picked me up on his way home.
ko: 그는 집에 가는 길에 저를 데리러 왔어요.

en: He promised to return and yet he didn't.
He will telephone you immediately when he comes back.
He returned to his land a different man.
ko: 그는 완전히 딴사람이 되어 고향으로 돌아왔어요.

en: He acted quickly and put out the fire.
He is a man of wit.
He is in good temper.
He is in an angry mood.
He's hard to please.
He is in a bad mood.
He was in a bad mood, which was rare for him.
He kept the invaders at bay with a machine gun.
He connected the cord to the machine.
He never missed any occasion to visit the museum.
He offered more than could be expected.
He was disappointed that things didn't turn out as he'd hoped.
As he is a married man, he has to think of the future.
He held the flag erect.
He put up a flag.
He moved the flags up and down.
He moved the desk to the right.
He cleared out his desk.
He cast an eye on an old vase on the table.
ko: 테이블 위에 있는 낡은 꽃병에 시선을 던졌어요.

en: He reached for an English-Japanese dictionary on the desk.
ko: 책상 위에 있는 영일 사전을 집으려고 손을 뻗었어요.

en: He laid the book on the desk.
He is at his desk.
He is studying at his desk.
He sat at his desk and began to prepare for the exam.
ko: 책상에 앉아서 시험 공부를 하기 시작했어요.

en: He is something like his father.
ko: 그는 아버지를 좀 닮은 구석이 있어요.

en: Many a time did he give me good advice.
ko: 그는 저한테 좋은 조언을 참 많이 해줬어요.

en: How many pieces of information did he get?
He is well versed in geometry.
He was brimming over with hope.
He fluctuated between hope and despair.
He sank under the weight of age.
He had a queer expression on his face.
He was thinking strange thoughts.
He is known for his eccentric conduct.
ko: 그는 엉뚱한 행동을 하는 거로 유명해요.

en: He is possessed by an unusual idea.
He recounted his unusual experiences.
He is a man with no standards.
He was willing to help others.
He is prepared to help me.
ko: 그는 나를 도와줄 준비가 되어 있어.

en: He gladly accepted our offer.
He is willing to stand by you.
ko: 그는 기꺼이 네 편이 되어줄 거야.

en: He will be only too glad to help you.
ko: 그는 너를 돕는 걸 아주 기뻐할 거야.

en: He will be pleased to help you.
ko: 그는 너를 도와주는 걸 즐거워할 거야.

en: He was entranced with joy.
He was transported with joy.
ko: 그는 너무 기뻐서 어쩔 줄 몰라 했어.

en: He was in critical condition.
Even though it meant risking danger, he decided to go there.
ko: 위험을 무릅쓰고서라도 그는 거기에 가기로 결심했어.

en: He was scornful of the danger.
He remained calm even in the presence of danger.
ko: 그는 위험 앞에서도 평정심을 잃지 않았어.

en: He is fearless of danger.
He suspected danger and didn't go near it.
ko: 그는 위험을 감지하고 근처에 가지 않았어.

en: He never shrinks from danger.
ko: 그는 위험 앞에서도 절대 물러나지 않아.

en: He showed courage in the face of danger.
He was calm in the presence of danger.
He was paralyzed in the face of danger.
He stood firm in the face of danger.
He proceeded in the face of danger.
He shrank back in the face of danger.
He became brave in the face of danger.
He exposed himself to danger.
He was exposed to danger.
He must be aware of the danger.
ko: 그는 분명 위험을 알고 있을 거야.

en: He was not aware of the danger.
He was unaware of the danger.
He was aware of the danger.
He underwent a risky operation.
He is not such a man as to flinch from danger.
ko: 그는 위험하다고 해서 겁먹을 사람이 아니야.

en: He was cool in the crisis.
He was almost drowned.
He narrowly escaped being run over.
ko: 그는 차에 치일 뻔했다가 간신히 면했어.

en: He came near being hit by a car.
He was almost hit by a car.
He was nearly run over by a car.
He barely missed being killed in the accident.
ko: 그는 그 사고에서 간신히 목숨을 건졌어.

en: He narrowly escaped being killed.
He barely missed being killed.
He works in the planning section.
He belongs to the planning section.
He looks pale. He must have drunk too much last night.
ko: 그는 안색이 창백해. 어제 술을 너무 많이 마셨나 봐.

en: He flushed into rage.
He did not so much as turn his head.
He is good-looking and smart.
He wiped the sweat off his face.
He felt the rain on his face.
He was red with anger.
He knows a lot of people.
He tried his best, but in the end he was defeated.
ko: 그는 최선을 다했지만 결국 지고 말았어.

en: He tried hard, but achieved nothing.
ko: 걔는 열심히 노력했지만 성과가 하나도 없었어.

en: He appears to be strong and healthy.
He was not about to admit his mistake.
ko: 걔는 자기 실수를 인정하려 하지 않았어.

en: He built his house on rock.
He looked sharply at me over his spectacles.
ko: 걔는 안경 너머로 나를 날카롭게 쳐다봤어.

en: He took off his glasses.
He took off his glasses and frowned at the nurse.
He can see nothing without his glasses.
ko: 걔는 안경 없으면 아무것도 안 보여.

en: He put on his glasses and began to read.
He is wearing glasses.
He wears glasses.
He looked at her over his glasses.
He lay on his back with his eyes closed.
ko: 걔는 눈을 감고 똑바로 누워 있었어.

en: He died of cancer.
He was terminally ill with cancer.
He made desperate efforts to reach the shore.
He was carried by the waves away from the shore and out to sea.
ko: 걔는 파도에 휩쓸려 해안에서 먼 바다로 떠내려갔어.

en: He is sawing a log into boards.
ko: 걔는 통나무를 톱질해서 판자로 만들고 있어.

en: He balanced himself on a log.
He repeatedly checked the mountain of related documents.
ko: 걔는 산더미 같은 관련 서류들을 계속해서 확인했어.

en: He acquired the habit of snacking.
He escaped being run over by a hair's breadth.
ko: 걔 진짜 아슬아슬하게 차에 치일 뻔했어.

en: He picked up the wrong hat by mistake.
He hit me by mistake.
By mistake, he turned left instead of right.
ko: 걔가 실수로 오른쪽이 아니라 왼쪽으로 돌았어.

en: He took the wrong bus by mistake.
He put salt into his cup of coffee by mistake.
It seems that he is wrong.
He must have taken the wrong train.
ko: 걔가 기차를 잘못 탄 게 분명해.

en: He set off in the wrong direction and got lost in the woods.
ko: 걔는 방향을 잘못 들어서 숲에서 길을 잃었어.

en: He tried different kinds of foods one after another.
He asked our pardon for making a mistake.
ko: 걔는 실수한 거에 대해 우리한테 사과했어.

en: He made a mistake.
He was very careful for fear he should make a mistake.
He was guilty of making a mistake.
He is afraid of making mistakes.
He discovered that he had made a mistake.
ko: 걔는 자기가 실수했다는 걸 알게 됐어.

en: He was very apologetic for the mistake.
ko: 걔는 실수한 거에 대해 정말 미안해했어.

en: He will without doubt succeed in the exam.
I'm sure he is holding back something from us.
ko: 걔 분명히 우리한테 숨기는 게 있어.

en: He promised to return the money without fail.
He will not fail to pay it.
He was soon accepted into the family.
It won't be a long time before he gets well.
It was not long before he got well.
ko: 걔는 얼마 안 가서 다 나았어.

en: He has an acute sense of observation.
He went to Hawaii to do some sightseeing.
His observation is sharp, but he says very little.
ko: 걔는 관찰력은 좋은데 말은 거의 안 해.

en: His observations are sharp, but he doesn't say much.
He gets up the tree without difficulty.
He climbs trees easily.
He has no trouble climbing trees.
ko: 걔 나무 타는 거 하나도 안 어려워해.

en: He is not a man to admit his mistakes easily.
ko: 걔는 자기 실수를 쉽게 인정할 사람이 아니야.

en: He will find the bus stop easily.
ko: 걔 버스 정류장 금방 찾을 거야.

en: He is not the sort of guy who gives in easily.
ko: 걔는 그렇게 쉽게 굽히는 스타일이 아니야.

en: He is not the kind of guy who gives in easily.
ko: 걔는 쉽게 포기하는 그런 애가 아니야.

en: He couldn't do even simple arithmetic.
He was advanced to a managerial post.
He was aware of being watched.
ko: 걔 누가 쳐다보고 있다는 거 알고 있었어.

en: He did not so much as greet the manager.
He doesn't care for sweet things.
He suffered an insult.
He can't resist sweets.
ko: 걔 단 거라면 사족을 못 써.

en: He had cut down on sweets.
He likes sweets.
He likes anything sweet.
He can't accommodate himself to his circumstances.
ko: 걔는 자기 처지에 적응을 못 해.

en: He made an admirable speech about protecting the environment.
ko: 걔 환경 보호에 대해서 진짜 멋지게 연설했어.

en: He adapted himself to circumstances.
He adapted to his environment.
He can't write any kanji.
He was covered with sweat.
He circulated from table to table at the reception.
He was moved to tears.
He responded to a speech of welcome.
He subdued his passions.
He makes no disguise of his feelings.
He is apt to give vent to his feelings.
He offered me some money in token of gratitude.
He gave me this doll in token of his gratitude.
He gave a tip as a sign of gratitude.
He has dull senses.
I am told he has a broad back.
He has a good position in a government office.
ko: 걔 관청에서 꽤 좋은 자리에 있어.

en: He is a person who never cuts corners.
ko: 걔는 절대 대충 하는 법이 없어.

en: He is a perfectionist.
He will think he has been completely forgotten.
ko: 걔 자기가 완전히 잊혀졌다고 생각할 거야.

en: He is good and drunk.
He is quite clearly out of danger.
He is completely absorbed in his business.
ko: 걔 자기 사업에 완전히 빠져 살아.

en: He is entirely in the wrong.
He was completely absorbed in his work.
He was all wrong.
He is far from perfect.
He is very sensitive to cold.
He was blue from the cold.
He was blue with cold.
He soon accustomed himself to cold weather.
He left his hometown on a cold morning.
ko: 걔 어느 추운 날 아침에 고향을 떠났어.

en: He lost a lot of money in the stock investment.
ko: 걔 주식 투자로 돈 엄청 날렸어.

en: He made a killing by investing in the stock market.
He lost a fortune in the stock market.
He invested 500,000 yen in stocks.
He made his timely escape from the stock market crash.
ko: 주식 폭락하기 직전에 딱 맞춰서 빠져나왔어.

en: He can invest a million yen in stocks.
He attached a label to the bag.
He slipped and nearly fell.
He is full of energy.
He is an active boy.
He is an active person.
He stopped up the crack with putty.
He has a beard.
He got a broken jaw and lost some teeth.
ko: 턱뼈가 부러지고 이빨도 몇 개 나갔어.

en: He wiped the sweat from his brow.
He was lost in thought with his hand on his forehead.
He put his hand to his forehead.
He sailed through the examination.
He writes English with ease.
He can read English easily.
He lay down in a comfortable position.
He plays the piano for his own amusement.
He boasts of his education.
He drove his car, whistling merrily.
He has experience as well as learning.
He is a diligent student, as students go.
He is being carried away by a student movement.
It appears that he's a student.
He seems to be a student.
It seems that he's a student.
He expelled the students from the room.
He is spoken ill of by his students.
He bade farewell to the students.
He is spoken well of by his students.
He was cross with his student.
He was angry with his students.
He is a student.
He found it hard to put his ideas across to his students.
ko: 자기 생각을 학생들한테 전달하는 걸 힘들어했어.

en: He attended the scientific conference.
He wanted to be respected by the students.
He should make the most of his chance to learn.
ko: 배울 수 있는 기회를 최대한 활용해야 해.

en: He made the most of his chance to learn.
ko: 배울 수 있는 기회를 최대한 활용했어.

en: He set up for learning.
I think he is not so much a scholar as a novelist.
He is not so much a scholar as a popular writer.
He is not so much a scholar as a poet.
He is not so much a scholar as a TV personality.
He is more a teacher than a scholar.
He is a writer rather than a scholar.
He is not a learned man, but a man of action.
He is a scholar, and ought to be treated as such.
ko: 그는 학자니까 그에 걸맞은 대우를 받아야 해.

en: He is thought of as a scholar.
He put on high airs with his learning, and he was not popular.
ko: 걔는 배운 거 가지고 너무 유세를 떨어서 인기가 없었어요.

en: He put on airs with his learning.
ko: 걔는 배운 거 가지고 잘난 척을 했어요.

en: He prides himself on his learning.
ko: 걔는 자기가 많이 배운 걸 아주 자랑스러워해요.

en: He was apt to boast of his knowledge.
ko: 걔는 툭하면 자기 지식을 뽐내곤 했어요.

en: He has not only learning but experience.
He is a learned man.
He is enjoying his school life.
ko: 걔는 학교 생활을 아주 즐겁게 하고 있어요.

en: He regrets having neglected his studies in his school days.
ko: 걔는 학창 시절에 공부 소홀히 한 걸 후회하고 있어요.

en: He is very glad that his school life is going well.
ko: 걔는 학교 생활이 잘 풀려서 아주 기뻐해요.

en: I hear he is to go abroad for study as soon as he graduates from school.
ko: 듣기로는 걔 졸업하자마자 유학 갈 거래요.

en: He made a figure in his school days.
ko: 걔는 학창 시절에 꽤 이름을 날렸어요.

en: He was anxious to finish school and make his own way in the world.
ko: 걔는 빨리 학교 졸업하고 자립하고 싶어 했어요.

en: His job had already been settled when he left school.
ko: 걔는 졸업할 때 이미 취업이 결정돼 있었어요.

en: After he left school, he went to London.
He set up the school.
He was absent from school.
He is absent from school.
He is often absent from school.
He often absents himself from school.
He often doesn't come to school.
He doesn't have to go to school.
He bought some stationery at the school store.
He was proud of his school record.
He did badly at school.
He is doing fine in school.
He knew more than all the school put together.
ko: 걔는 전교생을 다 합친 것보다 아는 게 더 많았어요.

en: He lives in the neighborhood of the school.
He is a member of the tennis club in our school.
He apologized to the teacher for coming to school late.
ko: 걔는 지각한 거에 대해서 선생님께 사과했어요.

en: He is proud of never having been late for school.
ko: 걔는 한 번도 지각 안 한 걸 아주 자랑스러워해요.

en: He is likely to be late for school.
He muttered complaints against the school.
He had a traffic accident on his way to school.
He was in time for school.
He instructed students in history at school.
He is doing very well at school.
Not only did he teach school, but he wrote novels.
ko: 걔는 학교에서 가르치기만 한 게 아니라 소설도 썼어요.

en: He was made much of at school.
He wanted to teach English at school.
ko: 걔는 학교에서 영어를 가르치고 싶어 했어요.

en: He regrets not having worked harder at school.
ko: 걔는 학교 다닐 때 공부 더 열심히 안 한 걸 후회해요.

en: He remained at the top of the class at school.
He does far better than you do at school.
ko: 걔가 너보다 학교 성적 훨씬 좋아.

en: He was seeking to do well at school.
ko: 걔는 학교 생활을 잘하려고 애쓰고 있었어요.

en: He came here before school was over.
ko: 걔는 학교 끝나기 전에 여기 왔어요.

en: He lives within a stone's throw of the school.
ko: 걔 학교에서 엎어지면 코 닿을 데 살아요.

en: He is unable to concentrate on his academic work.
He lives off campus.
He turned to the left at the corner.
He buys and sells leather goods.
He cannot be a slow learner.
ko: 걔가 배우는 게 느릴 리 없어.

en: He had an assured manner.
He has a firm belief.
He is clever, no doubt, but he is cold, too.
He is a famous man, to be sure, but I don't like him.
ko: 확실히 유명하긴 한데 난 별로 안 좋아해.

en: True, he likes to show off, but he is kind and generous.
ko: 잘난 척하는 건 맞지만 친절하고 마음이 넓어.

en: I am sure of his honesty.
It is true that he did his best, but he was not careful enough.
ko: 최선을 다한 건 맞는데 좀 부주의했어.

en: He is a fool, and no mistake.
No doubt he will bring the money on the appointed day.
ko: 약속한 날에 틀림없이 돈을 가져올 거야.

en: Certainly he is handsome and intelligent, but there is something about him that I can't like.
ko: 확실히 잘생기고 똑똑하긴 한데 왠지 정이 안 가.

en: He did say so.
He contends that nuclear weapons are necessary for national defense.
ko: 걔는 국방을 위해 핵무기가 필요하다고 주장해.

en: He jumped over the hedge.
He framed the picture he had bought on the street.
He looks just like a skeleton.
He's so thin that he looks like a skeleton.
While walking down a street, he ran into an old friend of his.
He expected to have seen her before he went out of town.
ko: 떠나기 전에 그녀를 만날 수 있을 줄 알았나 봐.

en: He was walking about in the town.
He doesn't seem to be heading for the town.
ko: 시내 쪽으로 가는 것 같지 않아.

en: He was ignorant of the fact that the town had been destroyed.
ko: 마을이 다 파괴됐다는 걸 모르고 있었어.

en: He is, on the whole, a satisfactory student.
As a rule, he arrives at the office about eight-thirty in morning.
He cleared his throat.
He was established as Foreign minister.
He protected his country from foreign invaders.
I think he gets a passing mark as Foreign Minister.
He is used to talking to foreigners.
He took little time getting ready to go out.
When he goes out, he asks me to keep an eye on his house.
ko: 나갈 때 나한테 집 좀 봐달라고 부탁해.

en: He has gone out.
Every time he goes out, he drops in at the bookstore.
He is not in.
He's not in.
He is rich enough to buy a foreign-made car.
He is engaged in foreign trade.
He has a foreign car.
He has been engaged in foreign trade for twenty years.
He has a lot of foreign stamps.
He was a foreigner and was treated as such.
ko: 외국인이었고 딱 그에 맞는 대우를 받았어.

en: He is a foreigner, and ought to be treated as such.
He worked hard for the purpose of buying a foreign car.
In order to buy a foreign car, he worked very hard.
He worked very hard so he could buy a foreign car.
ko: 외제차 살 수 있게 엄청 열심히 일했어.

en: He is well versed in foreign affairs.
He is quick at learning a foreign language.
He went abroad, never to return.
He went abroad.
He decided to go abroad.
He was determined to go abroad.
He has changed his mind about going abroad.
ko: 걔 외국 가는 거 마음 바꿨어요.

en: He is eager to go abroad.
ko: 걔 외국 가고 싶어서 안달 났어요.

en: He has written lots of books about his experience abroad.
ko: 걔는 해외 경험에 대해서 책을 많이 썼어요.

en: He had the privilege of studying abroad for two years.
ko: 걔는 운 좋게 2년 동안 유학할 기회가 있었어요.

en: He just returned from abroad.
He is outgoing.
He is wealthy in appearance but not in reality.
He had the appearance of a sportsman.
His appearance has changed so much that you may well not recognize him.
ko: 걔 외모가 너무 많이 변해서 못 알아볼 수도 있어요.

en: He was hospitalized for a surgical operation.
Besides being a surgeon, he was a famous writer.
ko: 걔는 외과 의사면서 유명한 작가이기도 했어요.

en: He addressed my full attention to the landscape outside.
ko: 걔가 내 시선을 온통 바깥 풍경에 쏠리게 했어요.

en: He tumbled down the stairs.
He ascended the stairs.
He ran up the stairs.
He jumped up the steps three at a time.
ko: 걔는 계단을 한 번에 세 칸씩 뛰어 올라갔어요.

en: He went up the steps slowly.
He saw a horrible face at the top of the stairs.
ko: 걔는 계단 꼭대기에서 끔찍한 얼굴을 봤어요.

en: He advocated abolishing class distinctions.
ko: 걔는 계급 차별을 없애야 한다고 주장했어요.

en: He came downstairs.
He practices medicine.
He will figure on inviting a lot of guests to the opening ceremony.
ko: 걔는 개업식에 손님을 많이 초대할 생각이에요.

en: He asked for samples of picture postcards.
ko: 걔가 그림엽서 샘플을 좀 달라고 했어요.

en: He brought the art of painting to perfection.
ko: 걔는 회화 예술을 완벽한 경지에 올려놓았어요.

en: He went to art school to study painting and sculpture.
ko: 걔는 그림이랑 조각을 공부하러 미대에 갔어요.

en: He hung a picture on the wall.
He is fond of painting.
Painting was the great love of his life.
He has an eye for art.
He is drawing a picture.
He decided to go to Paris for the purpose of studying painting.
ko: 걔는 그림 공부를 하러 파리에 가기로 했어요.

en: He has an aptitude for painting.
He has a sharp eye for painting.
ko: 걔는 그림을 보는 눈이 아주 날카로워요.

en: He is known to everybody.
He is respected by everyone.
He is respected by everybody.
He is worshiped as a god by everyone.
He is hated by all.
He is hated by everyone.
He picked up the ash-tray.
He is bent on buying the seaside villa.
ko: 걔는 바닷가 빌라를 사는 데 온 정신이 팔려 있어요.

en: He is a waiter in a seaside restaurant.
He crystallized salt from seawater.
He enjoyed a new life under the sea.
He has received a commission as a naval officer.
When he left the navy, he found it hard to adjust to life ashore.
ko: 걔는 해군을 그만두고 나서 육지 생활에 적응하는 걸 힘들어했어요.

en: He walked along the shore.
He gave up going abroad.
He has experience of foreign travel.
He is saving money for a trip abroad.
ko: 걔 해외여행 가려고 돈 모으고 있어.

en: He likes to travel abroad.
He did not study abroad for nothing.
ko: 걔가 괜히 유학 다녀온 게 아니야.

en: He studied abroad.
It is said that he will go abroad.
He knows a lot about foreign affairs.
ko: 걔 국제 정세에 대해서 잘 알아.

en: He made up his mind to study abroad.
He's afraid of the sea.
He crossed over the sea.
He rode a horse to the sea.
He was walking toward the sea.
He faced toward the sea.
ko: 걔 바다 쪽을 향해 서 있었어.

en: He lives within a stone's throw of the sea.
ko: 걔 바다랑 엎어지면 코 닿을 데 살아.

en: He resolved to turn over a new leaf.
He seems to have a fat purse.
ko: 걔 돈 좀 있는 것 같아.

en: He substituted for the injured player.
He received a large sum of money in compensation for his injury.
He suffered terrible pain from his injuries.
He died from wounds.
He lives comfortably.
He lives in comfort.
His salary enables him to live in comfort.
ko: 걔 월급이면 넉넉하게 살 수 있어.

en: He lives for nothing but pleasure.
He attached a "Fragile" label to the package.
He demanded a replacement for the broken part.
ko: 걔 고장 난 부품 교체해달라고 요구했어.

en: He tried to put the fragments of a broken vase together.
ko: 걔 깨진 화분 조각들을 맞춰보려고 했어.

en: He fixed the broken table.
He found a broken camera.
It's all up with him.
He is beyond the chance of recovery.
He has no chance of recovering.
There's no chance that he'll recover.
He is up and about again.
He meditated for two days before giving his answer.
ko: 걔 대답하기 전에 이틀 동안 고민했어.

en: He often breaks into the middle of a conversation.
He is an office worker.
It seemed that he had visited the office.
He spoke to me on behalf of the company.
He said in earnest that he would quit the company.
He was still in his teens when he founded a company.
His old company gave him the shaft. But I admire the way he turned bad luck into good and did even better with his own business.
ko: 걔 전 회사에서 뒤통수 맞았거든. 근데 전화위복으로 자기 사업 해서 더 잘된 거 보면 대단해.

en: He submitted his resignation in protest of the company's policy.
ko: 걔 회사 정책에 반대해서 사표 냈어.

en: He traveled at the expense of the company.

ko: 걔가 회사 매출의 절반 이상을 냈으니까, 자기 몫을 챙겨줄 거라고 기대했어.

en: He embezzled the money from his office.
He works with me at the office.
He's a friend from work.
He is a big man in the company.
ko: 걔 회사에서 꽤 영향력 있는 사람이야.

en: He set out on his career as a corporation lawyer.
ko: 걔 기업 전문 변호사로 커리어를 시작했어.

en: He pocketed the company's money.
He is the cash-box for his company.
He worked day and night in the interest of his firm.
He has done much for his company.
He goes to the office by car.

ko: 입사한 지 2년도 안 돼서 어학 실력을 인정받았어요.

en: He is a valuable acquisition to our company.
ko: 우리 회사에 아주 보배 같은 존재예요.

en: He must be working late at the office.
He doesn't get along with anybody in the office.
He got an important position in the company.
He occupies a prominent position in the firm.
He holds a high position at the company.
He is always on the go in his office.

He absented himself from the meeting.
He didn't attend the meeting.
He was absent from the meeting.

ko: 그 사람 회의에 늦을 것 같아요.

en: He canceled the appointment to attend the meeting.
He attends meetings off and on.
He won't be in time for the meeting.
He decided not to go to the meeting.
He prepared carefully for the meeting.
He was careful not to disrupt the meeting.
He tends to be late for meetings.
He armed himself with all the facts before asking questions at the meeting.
ko: 회의에서 질문하기 전에 모든 사실을 다 파악해 뒀어요.

en: He had a hard time making himself understood at the meeting.

ko: 회의 내내 한마디도 안 하고 가만히 있었어요.

en: He suggested we should stop smoking at the meeting.
He limited the membership to twenty.
He has the privileges of membership.
Illness prevented him from attending the party.
Illness kept him from attending the party.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 파티에 참석 못 했어요.

en: He couldn't attend the meeting because he was sick.
He called in to say he could not attend the meeting.
He presented himself at the meeting.
He makes friends with everybody he meets.
He spoke to whomever he met.
He always says "Hello" when I see him.
Every time I saw him, I found him to be taller.
ko: 볼 때마다 키가 더 커 있더라고요.

en: Every time he meets me, he brags about his car.
ko: 만날 때마다 자기 차 자랑을 해요.

en: He furnished the hungry with food.
He was born to be a painter.
He is a sort of painter.
He turned his artistic gifts to good account by becoming a painter.
ko: 예술적 재능을 잘 살려서 화가가 됐어요.

en: He has a great talent as a painter.
He cannot be an artist.
He was a painter, as I knew from his appearance.
He is a painter.
He had reached the limits of his patience.
As he couldn't endure, he took to his heels.
He expressed his thanks to us all.
He seems to be wary of us.
ko: 걔 우리를 좀 경계하는 것 같아.

en: He did not ignore our request, and neither did she.
ko: 걔도 우리 부탁을 무시하지 않았고, 그 여자애도 마찬가지였어.

en: He made fun of our ignorance.
He took no notice of our warning.
He failed to follow our advice.
He turned a deaf ear to my advice.
ko: 걔는 내 조언을 귓등으로도 안 들었어.

en: He is not of our number.
He's not in our group.
ko: 걔는 우리 무리에 안 끼어 있어.

en: He's not one of us.
He can sing better than any of us.
ko: 걔가 우리 중에 노래를 제일 잘 불러.

en: He is a man after our own hearts.
ko: 그 사람은 우리랑 마음이 정말 잘 맞는 사람이야.

en: He abused our trust.
He is worthy of our praise.
He is a man of great credit in our city.
ko: 그 사람은 우리 도시에서 정말 평판이 좋아.

en: He brought pressure to bear on our decision.

ko: 걔는 기자 회견을 열어주겠다는 우리 제안을 거절했어.

en: He did not live up to expectations.
He appealed to our emotions.
He played a very important part in our scientific research.
ko: 걔는 우리 과학 연구에서 정말 중요한 역할을 했어.

en: He lives next door but one to us.
He refused to listen to our request for help.
He should be apprised of our intentions.
He prides himself on having been accepted into our football team.
ko: 걔는 우리 축구팀에 들어온 걸 아주 자랑스러워해.

en: He is the most valuable player in our team.
ko: 걔가 우리 팀에서 가장 소중한 선수야.

en: He's the most valuable player on our team.
ko: 걔가 우리 팀에서 제일 가치 있는 선수야.

en: He is the best player on our team.
ko: 걔가 우리 팀에서 실력이 제일 좋아.

en: He provided us with everything we needed.
ko: 걔가 우리한테 필요한 걸 다 챙겨줬어.

en: He took a polite leave of us.
ko: 걔는 우리한테 정중하게 작별 인사를 하고 떠났어.

en: He is arrogant toward us.
He has given us not a little trouble.
He conceded us the use of his yacht.
He sent us his blessing.
He sprang a new request on us.
He bade us welcome.
I think he is holding something back from us.
ko: 걔 우리한테 뭐 숨기는 게 있는 것 같아.

en: He offered his help to us.
He promised us his assistance.
He entreated us help him.
He came to ask us to help him.
He asked us to help him.
He came to ask us for our help.
He advised us against doing it.
ko: 걔는 그거 하지 말라고 우리를 말렸어.

en: He warned us not to enter the room.
He urged us to obey the rule.
He partook of dinner with us.
He wants to come along with us to the movie.
ko: 걔도 우리랑 같이 영화 보러 가고 싶어 해.

en: He did it with us all with pleasure.
ko: 걔는 우리 모두랑 기쁘게 그 일을 했어.

en: He stood apart from us.
ko: 그는 우리랑 좀 떨어져서 서 있었어요.

en: He showed his heels to us.

ko: 그는 적한테 우리 위치를 알려줘서 우리를 배신했어요.

en: He represented our company at the conference.

ko: 그는 우리나라 최고의 인재 중 한 명이에요.

en: He committed an offense against our laws.
He is an honor to our country.

ko: 그는 우리나라에서 가장 훌륭한 과학자 중 한 명으로 꼽혀요.

en: He argued for our forming the alliance with that nation.
ko: 그는 그 나라와 동맹을 맺어야 한다고 주장했어요.

en: He's suffering from the effects of overwork.
He insulted our team.
He is tired from overwork.
His overwork brought on an illness.
My father fell ill because he worked too hard.
ko: 우리 아버지는 너무 무리하게 일하시다가 병이 나셨어요.

en: He has been exhausted from overwork.
He got sick from overwork.
He is very progressive, not to say radical.
He dwells on his past failures.
He meditated on his past life of suffering.
He dwelt on the pleasure of the past.
He accidentally hit his thumb with the hammer.
He saw that he was wrong.
ko: 그는 자기가 틀렸다는 걸 알게 됐어요.

en: He saw he was wrong.
The section chief keeps him down.
ko: 과장님이 그를 기 못 펴게 눌러요.

en: He was promoted to section chief.
He was made to check his papers by the chief.
ko: 그는 상사가 시켜서 서류를 확인해야 했어요.

en: He put down his burden.
He put the luggage down.
He answered with a look of annoyance.
He dropped a vase.
He broke the flower vase on purpose.
He bent over to see insects in the flowerbed.
ko: 그는 화단의 벌레를 보려고 몸을 굽혔어요.

en: He knows a lot about flowers.
ko: 그는 꽃에 대해 아주 잘 알아요.

en: He has a large basket full of flowers.
ko: 그는 꽃이 가득 담긴 큰 바구니를 가지고 있어요.

en: He sent her some flowers, along with a pretty card.

en: He extinguished the fire.

ko: 그는 불 피우는 법을 설명해 줬어요.

en: He is a budding singer.

ko: 그는 가수로 성공해서 인기가 아주 많아졌어요.

en: He is not a singer, but an actor.

ko: 그는 노래를 불러서 아이들을 즐겁게 해줬어요.

en: He came singing a song.

en: He is very popular because he is a good singer.
He is good at singing.
He wanted to make singing a career.
He started singing.
He started to sing.
He began to sing.
He began singing.
He sang and sang.
He kept singing.
He kept on singing.
He continued singing.
He sang while working.
He eats nothing else but fruit.
ko: 걔 과일 말고는 아무것도 안 먹어.

en: He didn't like to sing but they made him sing.

en: He eats nothing more than fruit.
ko: 걔 과일 말고는 딱히 먹는 게 없어.

en: He eats nothing but fruit.
He doesn't eat anything other than fruit.
ko: 걔 과일 말고 다른 건 안 먹어.

en: He doesn't eat anything except fruit.
ko: 걔 과일 빼고는 아무것도 안 먹어.

en: He eats nothing other than fruit.
He did it at his leisure.
He made the most of his free time.
If he had been free, he would have gone fishing.
ko: 걔 시간 있었으면 낚시 갔을 거야.

en: He said he wanted to be a scientist.
He studied very hard to become a scientist.
ko: 걔 과학자 되려고 진짜 열심히 공부했어.

en: He is famous as a scientist.
He won eminence as a scientist.
He is a scientist.
He is a scientist and musician.
He applied himself to this scientific study.
He is absorbed in scientific work.
ko: 걔 과학 연구에 푹 빠져 있어.

en: He doesn't show any interest in science.
He is keen on science.
His family circumstances were such that he became a teacher out of necessity.
ko: 걔 집안 형편상 어쩔 수 없이 선생님이 됐어.

en: He was way behind on his rent. As a result, he was evicted from his apartment.
ko: 걔 월세가 너무 많이 밀려서 아파트에서 쫓겨났어.

en: He is way behind on his rent.
He has a family to provide for.
He is working hard to support his family.
ko: 걔 가족들 먹여 살리려고 열심히 일해.

en: He has to work hard in order to support his family.
ko: 걔 가족 부양하려면 열심히 일해야 돼.

en: He has a sufficient income to support his family.
ko: 걔 가족들 먹여 살릴 만큼은 충분히 벌어.

en: He abandoned his family and went to live in Tahiti.

en: He abandoned his family and moved to Tahiti.

ko: 걔 가족 떠나서 타히티에서 살고 있어.

en: He provides for his family.

ko: 걔 가족들 안 깨우려고 조용히 들어왔어.

en: He is full of anxiety to please his family.

en: He took a photograph of the family.

en: He can imitate the rest of the family.
ko: 걔 다른 가족들 흉내 낼 줄 알아.

en: He likes to cook for his family.

en: He called at the baker's on the way home.

en: He was seen to come out of the house.

en: He stayed in Nagano throughout the summer.

en: He hates wearing a tie during the summer heat.

en: He doesn't like the heat of the summer.

He likes swimming in the summer.

en: He put up a notice about the change in price.

en: He had to part from her owing to unavoidable circumstances many years ago.

en: He came back after many years.
He looked as if he hadn't eaten for days.
He often goes without food for days.
He had to go without food for days.

en: He interrupted the speaker with frequent questions.

en: He looked back at us many times and walked away.

en: He tried again and again, but didn't succeed.

en: He has been to Europe many times.

ko: 걔가 문을 계속 두드렸는데 아무 대답이 없었어.

en: He knocked on the door again and again, but there was no answer.

en: He tried several times, but failed.

en: He is writing to some friends of his.

en: He would sit and look at the sea for hours.

en: He will often sit and look at the sea for hours.

en: He has been driving for hours.

en: He has a negative attitude to everything.

en: He is very thorough about everything.

ko: 걔는 뭐 하나 마음에 들어 하질 않아.

en: He had his own way over everything.

en: He is always taking his own way in anything.

en: What is he aiming at?

ko: 걔 지금 뭔 소리 하는 거야? 도무지 말이 안 돼.

en: What did he look up?

What was he up to?

ko: 걔는 하는 것마다 다 잘 풀려.

en: What is he so angry about?

What does he plan to do?

en: What is he doing?

en: What does he want to do?

en: He hasn't left any message.

en: He will not accomplish anything.

en: He did nothing wrong.

ko: 걔 나쁜 짓 한 거 없어.

en: He was smiling as if nothing had happened to him.
ko: 걔는 아무 일도 없었다는 듯이 웃고 있었어.

en: He has nothing to do.

en: He would often sit for hours doing nothing.
ko: 걔는 종종 아무것도 안 하고 몇 시간씩 앉아 있곤 했어.

en: He would sit for hours doing nothing.

en: He would often sit here for hours doing nothing.

en: Everything seems to go right with him.
ko: 걔는 모든 게 다 잘 풀리는 것 같아.

en: He is good for nothing.

en: He has no redeeming traits.

en: There is nothing to him.

en: He managed to escape.

en: He talks as if he knows everything.

en: He talks as though he knew everything.

en: He is nothing more than a coward.

en: He was accused of cowardice.

en: He fell down from the roof, and what made the matter worse, broke his leg.

en: He fell from the roof head over heels.
